data.title: Why Students Choose uk as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose UK as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: It's highly likely that UK will come up whenever you ask someone about their higher studies. There are definitely a lot of people interested in this island country. What are the reasons behind the high demand for studying abroad in UK? Here are a few of the most compelling ones

faq.question: What is the ideal intake for the UK?
faq.answer:
This depends on the program, level of study, and the institution you're applying to. The September intake is typically the most preferred. For this intake, the majority of universities offer all major courses. While this intake is the most competitive, it’s also the one where you have the most number of seats and programs open.

Starting your applications early and making sure to submit a thorough and complete package that matches your chosen program’s eligibility criteria boosts your chances of admission. But don’t fret if you miss the Fall intake - the Winter intake is comparable in terms of course availability and a good option to start your program without having to wait another academic year.

faq.question: Is it expensive to study in the UK?
faq.answer: In comparison to places like the USA, the UK's tuition fees and cost of living objectively seem to be on the higher end. Do your homework to determine your cost expectations, though, as affordability is subjective, depending on your own budget, and can vary considerably based on your needs. And remember, scholarships and education loans can help lighten the financial burden considerably!

data.description:
Study in the UK

Why Students Choose the UK as a Study Abroad Destination

  1. The UK has a great number of top universities in the world with hundreds of programs to choose from! 7 British universities rank in the top 50 in the QS World University Rankings 2023. In total, 89 UK universities land a spot on these world rankings. The reputation and worldwide recognition of UK higher education reflect in these numbers. A degree from an institution in the United Kingdom opens doors for you. Having these credentials will make you stand out to potential employers all across the world.
  2. Experience in the workforce is highly regarded by most workplaces. The good news is that you can work part-time as an international student in the UK. During the academic year, you can work a maximum of 20 hours per week. Gaining relevant work experience during your studies will set you apart from other graduates when seeking for jobs. It also gives you an idea of what to expect as you enter the working world. Another plus - some UK programs require a work placement or internship as part of the curriculum. This means you will get work experience as part of the degree!
  3. The United Kingdom is a popular study abroad destination because the history of international students studying in UK universities is centuries long. These universities are used to and take pride in having students from all walks of life and from around the world in their classrooms. This means you get to experience a really culturally diverse atmosphere, and can have an easier time settling in.

Top Universities & Courses in the UK

In the United Kingdom, universities typically welcome new students in either September or January. There is also sometimes a short summer intake, though this tends to be less popular and has the fewest available classes. It's important to keep in mind that specific institution and course deadlines and start dates may differ. Make sure you apply on time by researching the deadlines for each institution and major. The key intakes in the UK are:

  • September Intake
  • January Intake
  • April/May Intake

You can take the first steps towards your career and future goals with a degree from a UK university. You can most certainly discover the perfect programme for you here, taught by experts in their fields and with excellent standards of quality assurance. Let’s look at some of the best universities in the UK and programs they offer:

University QS World University Rankings Tuition Fee Per Year (GBP) Popular Programs
The University of Edinburgh 15
  • Undergraduate: GBP 18,200 to 32,600
  • Postgraduate: GBP 22,00 to 24,400
  • Bachelor of Digital Communications
  • Bachelor of Law in Criminology
The University of Manchester 28
  • Undergraduate: GBP 19,000 to 46,000
  • Postgraduate: GBP 12,400 to 45,000
  • BEng Computer Systems Engineering
  • MPhil Biological Chemistry
King's College London 37
  • Undergraduate: GBP 23,200 to 37,700
  • Postgraduate: GBP 16,400 to 31,100
  • BA in History and International Relations
  • MSc in Electronic Engineering with Management
The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) 56
  • Undergraduate: GBP 25,270 to 40,530
  • Postgraduate: GBP 38,000 to 40,000
  • BSc Psychological and Behavioural Science
  • MSc Finance and Economics
University of Bristol 61
  • Undergraduate: GBP 21,000 to 28,000
  • Postgraduate: GBP 24,700 to 38,000
  • BSc Medical Microbiology
  • MSc Biomedical Sciences Research
The University of Warwick 64
  • Undergraduate: GBP 21,250 to 27,160
  • Postgraduate: GBP 18,890 to 43,950
  • BSc in Computer Science with Business Studies
  • MSc in Scientific Research and Communication

Scholarships for International Students in the UK

The UK has been a leading example in international education for decades. It continues to attract and retain international talents in order to carry on this tradition and preserve its position as a world leader in higher education. One of the ways universities do this is through scholarships and other forms of financial aid that make a UK education accessible to international students. Let’s look at some scholarships in the UK:

  • Lancaster Global Scholarship
  • Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships by Newcastle University
  • Aberdeen Global Scholarship
  • Chevening Program
  • Women in STEM scholarship by British Council

These hardly scratch the surface of the options available. You can narrow down scholarships by study level, your program of interest, and even sociodemographic factors like scholarships by country of origin!

Get a head start on your research, make sure you qualify, and narrow down your choices to the best ones for you. More research means more success while trying to win a university scholarship in the UK.

Visa Requirements for the UK Student Visa

Once you successfully apply to a UK university and receive the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS), you can then apply for the Student visa. Take a look at our rundown of the requirements for obtaining a student visa in the UK:

  • Valid Passport
  • Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS)
  • English Proficiency test scores
  • Recent passport-sized photographs
  • CV/Resume
  • Immigration Health Surcharge payment
  • Proof of finance and details of the sponsor

Depending on the country of origin, you may also have to sit for a credibility interview, give biometrics, and/or provide a tuberculosis test report. Be sure to check into the visa requirements applicable to you well before you start applying!

Work Opportunities in the UK for International Students

Many students decide to study abroad with the hopes of landing a part-time job during their time there. If your Student visa authorizes you for part-time work, here are some student jobs available in the UK to take advantage of

  • Teaching Assistant
  • Dog walker
  • Retail Worker
  • Translator
  • Barista
  • Tutor
  • Hotel Receptionist
  • Cook

At degree level or higher, you can work 20 hours per week during “term-time” - in other words while your semester is in full swing. Over term or semester breaks, you can work full-time!

You can also access internship and work placement opportunities that are a part of your program during your time in the UK. And with the UK Graduate visa, you can continue staying in the UK after completing your program to look for work!

Opportunities to gain international job experience are enhanced by studying abroad. In the UK, you have the chance to gain practical experience in a major global economy. You can really set yourself apart from the competition with this kind of experience.

Concluding Thoughts

If you want to study abroad, Australia is a great option. Opportunity knocks when you have degrees from prestigious institutions around the world, and Australia is a great place to get them. In addition to a bright academic future, studying abroad can help you gain valuable work experience in one of the world's most advanced economies, expose you to a new culture, and prepare you for a lifelong commitment to a country with an exceptional standard of living.

data.title: Why Students Choose the USA as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose the USA as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: The consistency with which US universities appear in various international rankings is impressive. Academic excellence is a constant goal for US universities. 17 US universities rank in the top 50 of QS World University Rankings 2023. In fact, the #1 spot is held by an American university - the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).

faq.question: Does the USA provide full scholarships to international students?
faq.answer: Scholarships for international students attending universities in the United States range from fully funded to partially funded and it varies across the universities or organizations providing the scholarships.

faq.question: What are the best US cities for international students?
faq.answer: University and college environments in several US cities can differ widely. Which cities are best for students can be difficult to generalize since it’s a matter of preference! Nonetheless, according to QS Best Student Cities 2023, there are 5 US cities in the top 50, among which Boston is the best city for international students in the USA.

data.description:
Study in the USA

Why Students Choose the USA as a Study Abroad Destination

  1. The consistency with which US universities appear in various international rankings is impressive. Academic excellence is a constant goal for US universities. 17 US universities rank in the top 50 of QS World University Rankings 2023. In fact, the #1 spot is held by an American university - the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). The faculty at these institutions consist of recognized authorities in respective specialties. US institutions are also renowned for their innovative and industry-relevant curricula and cutting-edge approaches to teaching and learning. Employers and schools in the US will see your degree as proof of your potential and skill.
  2. As an international student, you’ll be reassured thanks to the importance US colleges and universities place on cultural diversity. Thanks to this, you will have an easier time settling into a multicultural campus community. The United States is a cultural mosaic, with people and influences from all over the world represented in many of its regions.Not only will finding communities representing your nationality and culture stave off the homesickness, it also gives you the chance to interact and befriend people from all over the world.
  3. Depending on your program and other criteria, you may be eligible for both{' '} {' '} Curricular Practical Training (CPT) and Optional Practical Training (OPT) as an international student. These are opportunities to get professional experience related to your field as a student. Taking advantage of these possibilities can help you make the most of your time working in the United States. You can't replicate the experience of putting what you learn in class into practice in a real-world working setting. One of the world's most advanced economies provides the setting for you to become an expert in your profession. We’ll talk about CPT and OPT in more detail in a bit.

Top Universities & Courses in the USA

US universities, like those in other popular study abroad destinations, have three admission intakes per year: fall, spring, and summer. There are several institutions that only take students in the fall and spring, with fall being the more common option.

  • Fall Intake: August-September
  • Spring Intake: January
  • Summer Intake: May

The best way to determine which university is right for you is to devote some time and effort to research. It is usually a good idea to make a list of what you're looking for in a university and then use this as a starting point for your search. Let’s look at some of the best universities in the USA and the great programs they offer:

University QS World University Rankings Popular Courses Tuition Fee Range Per Year
University of Texas at Austin 72
  • Undergraduate: USD 40,996 to 57,512
  • Postgraduate: USD 52,569 to 59,856
  • Bachelor of Petroleum engineering
  • MS in Information Technology and Management
University of Wisconsin-Madison 83
  • Undergraduate: USD 28,916 to 58,912{' '}
  • Postgraduate: USD 35,712 to 49,618
  • Bachelor of Science in Nursing
  • Master of Science in Clinical Nutrition
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign 85
  • Undergraduate: USD 36,998 to 46,944
  • Postgraduate: USD 32,034 to 49,500
  • Bachelor of Science in Bioengineering
  • Master of Science in Technology Management
Georgia Institute of Technology 88
  • Undergraduate: USD 31,370 to 50,270
  • Postgraduate: USD 29,200 to 41,200
  • Bachelor of Science in Bioinformatics
  • M.Sc. Supply Chain Engineering
Pennsylvania State University 93
  • Undergraduate: USD 19,286 to 40,151
  • Postgraduate: USD 29,558 to 41,602
  • Undergraduate: AUD 29,655 to 39,540Bachelor of Design in Digital Multimedia Design
  • Master of Engineering Management
Rice University 100
  • Undergraduate: USD 19,286 to 40,151
  • Postgraduate: USD 29,558 to 41,602
  • B.A. in Architecture
  • Master of Bioengineering

Scholarships for International Students in the USA

The availability of scholarships is a key consideration while selecting a university. If securing a scholarship is crucial to your study abroad goals, you should devote much time and effort to the process. The most prestigious honors given out at any given institution are also the hardest to win. By diversifying and narrowing your scholarship hunt, you can increase your success rate. Some scholarships in the USA for internationals students are as follows:

  • International Students Academic Merit Scholarship by East Tennessee State University
  • International Student Scholarship by Grand Valley State University
  • Scholarships for Law in the USA by Drake University
  • Khursheed Fatima Scholarship - Northern Arizona University
  • Fulbright Scholarship
  • Least Developed Countries Scholarship - University of California, Berkeley Law

Remember, there are dozens if not hundreds of scholarship options in the USA to explore. You could look into need-based scholarships - awards universities grant to students with financial need - or merit-based scholarships - awards for students who excel academically and in other fields.

Visa Requirements for the US Student Visa

If you want to study in the United States as an international or nonimmigrant student, you'll need an F-1 student visa. After successfully getting admission into your dream US university, you will receive the Form I-20 - one of the most important documents in your international student journey. With the Form I-20 you can start applying for the F-1 student visa. Let's take a look at the requirements:

  • Passport with validity of 6 months
  • Original and signed Form I-20 and SEVIS ID
  • CV/Resume
  • Filled out DS 160 form
  • Program and university details
  • Visa interview
  • Coloured passport photos
  • Proof of educational background
  • Proof of finances

Depending on the country you are applying from, the documents you need for the visa interview may vary. So be sure to look into the requirements when booking and attending your visa interview appointment!

Work Opportunities in the USA for International Students

As an international student in the USA, you have the option of getting work experience in the USA through CPT or OPT. Both CPT and OPT have to be related to the field you are studying in the USA.

What is CPT?

Curricular Practical Training allows non-immigrant foreign students studying at a US college or university to work temporarily while in the country. CPT is a part of your curriculum - meaning professional experience is a part and prerequisite of completing your degree.

What is OPT?

Optional Practical Training is a period of time during which F-1 students who have graduated or been enrolled in their degree program for more than nine months are authorized by USCIS to engage in practical training related to their field of study. Pre-completion OPT involves working while you are a student, whereas post-completion OPT refers to work after you complete your program. There is a limit of 12 months for OPT - meaning if you worked nine months during Pre-Completion OPT you can only work for three months for Post-Completion OPT. STEM students can extend their stay by 24 months.

During your first year of university, international students on an F-1 visa are restricted 20 hours per week to on-campus work. After this first year, students can access off-campus work opportunities through CPT and OPT.

Concluding Thoughts

When it comes to higher education, the USA stands out as a top destination. You may rest assured that you are beginning your academic career in the proper place thanks to the high quality of educational institutions, the professionalism and expertise of the faculty, the leading edge research and technology used to advance both knowledge and learning, and the energy and excitement of the classroom settings. Studying in the USA provides an unforgettable education and job experience. As a student, you will have many chances to develop into your full potential.

data.title: Why Students Choose Australia as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose Australia as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: It's highly likely that Australia will come up whenever you ask someone about their higher studies. There are definitely a lot of people interested in this island country. What are the reasons behind the high demand for studying abroad in Australia? Here are a few of the most compelling ones:

faq.question: Is it possible for a Bangladeshi student to study in Australia without IELTS?
faq.answer: Yes, you can apply with MOI or other test scores like PTE, TOEFL, Duolingo and so on.

faq.question: In Australia, what is the minimum age to work a part-time job?
faq.answer: There is no uniform minimum age policy across the country; rather, different states and territories set their own standards. Still, if you're 18 or older, you can legally work part-time in Australia.

data.description:
Study in the Australia

Why Students Choose Australia as a Study Abroad Destination

It's highly likely that Australia will come up whenever you ask someone about their higher studies. There are definitely a lot of people interested in this island country. What are the reasons behind the high demand for studying abroad in Australia? Here are a few of the most compelling ones:

  1. The standard of education offered is, of course, crucial in making a final decision on where to enroll. Throughout history, universities in Australia have been a breeding ground for innovative thinkers and doers. 5 Australian universities make it to the top 50 in the QS World University Rankings in 2023. These prestigious institutions are among the best in the world when it comes to teaching and research.
  2. Australia's diversity is one of the things that draws foreign students to the country. 6 Australian cities rank in the top 40 of the QS Best Student Cities 2023. Among the reasons contributing to these are the cities’ student mix, where Melbourne is leading the race! You'll fit right in with the many languages, cultures, nationalities, and ethnic groups that make up the world's smallest continent.
  3. Post-graduation opportunities are another plus of studying in Australia. The country ranks high on the list of nations that welcome international students with open arms. If you are eligible for a Subclass 485 visa after graduation, you can extend your time in Australia from two to four years upon graduation. This lets you seek and take advantage of work opportunities and work towards permanent residency to call Australia your forever home!

Applying to Australian Universities

Holding an Australian university degree says a lot about how qualified you are as a graduate. To take advantage of this, you need to understand the Australian way of higher education. The Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) conceptualizes the different levels of higher education in the country. It offers a system that makes it easy to translate international academic qualifications to their Australian equivalence.

Before enrolling, you also need to verify that your selected degree is recognised by CRICOS (the Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students). We’ll discuss both in a bit more detail below.

What is AQF?

Australian education and training are governed by the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF), a national policy. It combines the credentials from every area of education and training into a solitary comprehensive and balanced qualifications framework.

The AQF has ten levels in total:

  • Levels 1-7 - undergraduate studies (diplomas, certifications, and three-year Bachelor’s degrees)
  • Level 8 - four-year Bachelor’s degrees
  • Level 9 - Master’s degrees
  • Level 10 - Postdoctoral degrees

What is CRICOS?

The Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS) was established by the Education Services for Overseas Students Act of 2000. It keeps a list of the schools and programs that have state and territorial approval to instruct international students.

So, naturally, as an international student your course needs to be CRICOS-registered to receive a Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE)! And heads up - you need the CoE to apply for your student visa, or the Subclass 500.

Top Universities & Courses in Australia

The world-class universities in Australia offer some of the most popular courses around the world. Let’s take a look at the intakes and courses for these universities!

There are normally two major intakes at Australian universities. Nonetheless, some universities offer three intakes throughout the year.

  • Semester 1: February-March
  • Semester 2: July-August
  • Semester 3: September-November
University QS World University Rankings Popular Courses Tuition Fee Range Per Year
Australian National University (ANU) 30
  • Bachelor of Applied Data Analytics
  • Master of Engineering in Mechatronics
  • Undergraduate: AUD 39,024 to 41,030
  • Postgraduate: AUD 43,680 to 54,880
The University of Melbourne 33
  • Bachelor of Biomedicine
  • Master of Entrepreneurship
  • Undergraduate: AUD 40,104 to 49,496
  • Postgraduate: AUD 44,864 to 46,304
The University of Sydney 41
  • Bachelor of Pharmacy and Management
  • Master of Project Management
  • Undergraduate: AUD 45,000 to 57,000
  • Postgraduate: AUD 41,000 to 73,000
The University of New South Wales 45
  • Bachelor of Information Systems
  • Master of Data Science
  • Undergraduate: AUD 41,225 to 49,600
  • Postgraduate: AUD 32,920 to 48,280
The University of Queensland 50
  • Bachelor of Architectural Design
  • Master of Quantitative Biology
  • Undergraduate: AUD 29,655 to 39,540
  • Postgraduate: AUD 17,504 to 24,688
Monash University 57
  • Bachelor of Medical Science, Doctor of Medicine
  • Master of Environment and Sustainability
  • Undergraduate: AUD 29,700 to 39,600
  • Postgraduate: AUD 28,700 to 42,000
The University of Western Australia 90
  • Bachelor of Automation and Robotics
  • Master of Information Technology
  • Undergraduate: AUD: 35,900 to 44,700
  • Postgraduate: AUD 17,950 to 89,200

Scholarships for International Students in Australia

There are usually plenty of partially or fully funded scholarships available from universities, the Australian government, public & private organizations, and so on. Some great examples of the types of scholarship you can access are:

  • Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships Scheme by University of Sydney
  • UOW Postgraduate Academic Excellence Scholarship
  • Mitchell History Award by UNSW
  • Reid Malley Foundation Scholarship
  • Deakin International Merit Scholarship

Research is the key to finding the greatest scholarships in Australia for you. Universities and institutions like the government often specifically set aside scholarships for international students. Scholarships also exist by study level, by subject, and even based on sociodemographic factors like your country of origin. If you put in the time and effort, you should be able to find the perfect scholarship.

Visa Requirements for the Australian Student Visa

Once you receive a Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE), you can apply for the Subclass 500 visa! The requirements for the student visa are as follows:

  • Test scores for English Proficiency tests (IELTS, PTE, Duolingo)
  • Confirmation of Enrolment or CoE from a university in Australia
  • Recent passport-sized photographs
  • Genuine Temporary Entrant Statement or GTE
  • Recommendation Letters
  • CV/Resume
  • OSHC, or Overseas Student Health Cover
  • Proof of funding to study in Australia from Bangladesh

You may also need to provide biometrics, a health check report, and other additional documents.

Work Opportunities in Australia for International Students

Students who have a Subclass 500 visa can work for 40 hours every fortnight (two weeks) in Australia. Some student job opportunities include:

  • Barista
  • Bartender
  • Driver
  • Nanny
  • Bookkeeper
  • Tutor
  • Library assistant

You can apply for work in person, on campus or through job portals. If your program involves internships and work placements, you can also access real industry experience in Australia!

After you graduate, you can apply for a Subclass 485 visa if you want to continue staying and working in Australia. To apply for the Subclass 485 visa, you need:

  • A qualification for a CRICOS-registered course from an Australian institution
  • A valid student visa that you held in the past 6 months
  • Proof of good character
  • Proof that you meet the country’s minimum health requirements
  • Signed Australian Values Statement

You must also not owe the Australian government any debts or have any rejected visas in your travel history.

The length of your post-study visa varies depends on your qualification as well:

  • Bachelor’s Degree/Bachelor’s (Honors) Degree: 2 year visa
  • Master’s Degree (Coursework): 2 year visa
  • Master’s Degree (Research): 3 year visa
  • Doctoral Degree: 4 year visa

Concluding Thoughts

If you want to study abroad, Australia is a great option. Opportunity knocks when you have degrees from prestigious institutions around the world, and Australia is a great place to get them. In addition to a bright academic future, studying abroad can help you gain valuable work experience in one of the world's most advanced economies, expose you to a new culture, and prepare you for a lifelong commitment to a country with an exceptional standard of living.

data.title: Why Students Choose Canada as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose Canada as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: If you have a degree or certificate from a Canadian university, prospective employers, coworkers, and boards for higher study will instantly recognise your potential, talent, and expertise.

faq.question: Is studying in Canada affordable for international students?
faq.answer: The numerous universities and provinces in Canada have different tuition and living expenses. We strongly advise doing research as much as you can about the universities you're thinking about, as well as the expense of living there. Affordability is subjective to the student and the student’s budget, but with the range of options available, we believe you can find something perfect for you. Plus, there’s plenty of scholarship options to look into as well!

faq.question: How much does a student visa to Canada cost?
faq.answer: The application fee for a study permit is CAD 150. There are additional costs if biometric data must be provided or if you must participate in an interview. Don't forget to confirm if these are necessary in your country.

data.description:
Study in the Canada

Why Students Choose Canada as a Study Abroad Destination

  1. If you have a degree or certificate from a Canadian university, prospective employers, coworkers, and boards for higher study will instantly recognise your potential, talent, and expertise.{' '} International rankings for Canadian universities are consistently very high . Canada has 11 universities in the top 300, according to the QS World University Rankings for 2023. A degree or certification from these institutions is acknowledged throughout the world as evidence of your aptitude, expertise, and potential. Even just having this on your record can give you access to job and higher education options!
  2. If you are in any kind of academic, vocational, or professional training programme, you probably already meet the standards for working part-time in Canada. Once qualified, you can work up to 20 hours per week and full-time during scheduled breaks! The option to work as an international student is one of the biggest perks of studying here.
  3. Many international students find it scary to think about leaving their home country. Still, you might be able to{' '} find a piece of home in Canada. Here, people from different countries, religions, ethnic groups, and races live together peacefully. Canadians are proud of their multicultural identity, and they are very friendly and open to newcomers. You'll meet people from all over the world, as well as people from your own country. You can experience the whole world in one place, from food to art to festivals and celebrations.
  4. Alongside part-time work options, Canadian education offers plenty of {' '} opportunities to enhance your practical experience in your field . Many programs offer co-op - which means completing professional experience is part of completing your degree. You can also access post-study work permits to continue staying and working in Canada after graduating!

Top Universities & Courses in Canada

Canadian institutions provide year-round flexible admission choices. You must be aware of the admissions requirements for international students at Canadian universities and determine when to begin your application process. There are 3 intakes Canadian universities typically accept:

  • Fall (September intake)
  • Winter (January intake)
  • Spring/Summer (May intake)

Let’s take a look at the top universities to study in Canada:

University QS World University Rankings Popular Courses Tuition Fee Range Per Year
McGill University 31
  • Undergraduate: CAD 31,000 to 63,000
  • Postgraduate: CAD 20,000 to 54,000
  • Master of Science (M.Sc.) Bioresource Engineering
  • Master of Arts (M.A.) Economics
University of Toronto 34
  • Undergraduate: CAD 20,000 to 63,770
  • Postgraduate: CAD 38,200 to 61,350
  • Bachelor of Applied Science (Civil Engineering)
  • Master of Management of Innovation
University of British Columbia 47
  • Undergraduate: CAD 20,600 to 61,750
  • Postgraduate: CAD 42,550 to 58,700
  • Computer Science (BSc)
  • Biomedical Engineering(BSc)
University of Alberta 110
  • Undergraduate: CAD 33,200 to 55,350
  • Postgraduate: CAD 29,500 to 55,700
  • Bachelors in Business studies
  • The Alberta Executive MBA
Université de Montréal 116
  • Undergraduate: CAD 20,190 to 40,000
  • Postgraduate: CAD 25,000 to 45,000
  • Undergraduate Doctorate in Dentistry
  • Bachelor of Laws
University of Waterloo 154
  • Undergraduate: CAD 40,000 to 64,750
  • Postgraduate: CAD 22,500 to 65,180
  • Bachelors in Biotechnology
  • Masters in Computational Mathematics

Scholarships for International Students in Canada

Some Canadian universities may have lower education fees than similar institutions in other English-speaking countries. But spending a lot of money on a full-time degree is still a big financial decision. Most students hope to get some kind of financial aid to help them pay for school. International students can get a wide range of scholarships and prizes from Canadian universities. There are many universities in Canada that give hundreds of scholarships. Here are just a few examples:

  • Outstanding International Student Award by University of British Columbia
  • York University Academic Excellence Scholarships for International Students
  • Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships
  • Pierre Elliot Trudeau Foundation Scholarship

Visa Requirements for the Canadian Student Visa

Once you have a letter of acceptance from your chosen Canadian university, you can start the process of getting your study permit. These are the requirements:

  • Passport, ID documents
  • Most recent passport-sized photos
  • Letter of acceptance from a DLI
  • Proof of funding
  • Letter of intent/explanation
  • Proof of language proficiency
  • Police clearance
  • Medical check-up reports
  • Biometrics

You may also need to provide biometrics, a health check report, and other additional documents.

Work Opportunities in Canada for International Students

Work opportunities in Canada for students are vast. The majority of universities offer co-op programmes and job placements to help you gain this practical experience. Programs themselves are structured according to industry trends and demands. If your study permit is still in effect, you are permitted to work full- or part-time on and off campus. Students can work 20 hours a week part-time, and work full-time when classes are on break. Some part-time positions for students are as follows:

  • Uber Driver
  • Freelancer
  • Tutor
  • Barista
  • Dog Walker
  • Translator
  • Nanny

After finishing your program, you are also eligible for post-study opportunities through the Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP). If you successfully apply for the PGWP, you can continue to live and work in Canada after completing your program. The length of your stay will depend on the duration of the program. If the program is:

  • Eight months or longer - visa validity is the same length as program length
  • Two years or more - visa validity can be up to three years

Concluding Thoughts

Canada offers excellent education, numerous chances for employment and permanent residence, and a high standard of living. The educational system is designed to keep pace with advancements made in the working world. Additionally, the nation is quite open to skilled foreigners who can boost the Canadian economy. For international students, Canada is extraordinarily welcoming and accessible—from studying here to working and living here. Everything that the nation has to offer, from food and travel to entertainment and culture, will enchant you. Student life in Canada is an unparalleled experience, with nice people and helpful services making everything from transit to government paperwork simple sailing.

data.title: Why Students Choose Germany as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose Germany as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: Germany offers a high quality of education with hundreds of programs to choose from. About 46 German universities rank in the QS World University Rankings 2023. German universities are often academic and research leaders in fields of interest including business and technology

faq.question: Which majors are in high demand in Germany?
faq.answer: Power engineering, management and technology, international automotive engineering, mechatronics, and optical technologies are some of the most in-demand majors in Germany.

faq.question: How much does a student visa to Germany cost?
faq.answer: The standard price for the Type D visa to Germany is EUR 75.

faq.question: What is Zertifikat B1?
faq.answer: An internationally recognised test of German language proficiency is the Zertifikat Deutsch. According to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages, it measures competency at a level that corresponds to level B1.

data.description:
Study in the Germany

Why Students Choose Germany as a Study Abroad Destination

  1. Germany offers a high quality of education with hundreds of programs to choose from. About 46 German universities rank in the QS World University Rankings 2023. German universities are often academic and research leaders in fields of interest including business and technology. Tuition costs in these universities are also very low as some public universities waive tuition fees entirely or charge a small administrative fee.
  2. This country is a cultural mosaic. Students from all over the world come together and live in a bubble of diverse traditions and culture in cities like Berlin. And students have the opportunity to travel to other European countries while in Germany too.
  3. The living cost in Germany is quite low compared to other study abroad destinations. The average living cost for a student is around EUR 1700 and people in Germany enjoy a high quality life. And according to QS Top Universities, Munich is the 2nd best student city in the world with a desirability rate of 92.6!

Top Universities & Courses in Germany

There are two main intake seasons in Germany: the summer and the winter. The winter semester is typically the busiest application period for German universities. The majority of scholarship and grant applications are due in July or August, and the intake period begins between September and October. International students interested in enrolling in a German university should start the admissions procedure one year before the start of the enrollment term. The two intakes are:

  • Winter: September-October
  • Summer: April

If you want to study law, medicine, commerce, or engineering, some of the top universities in the world for these disciplines can be found in Germany, including the University of Bonn and the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. Many top-tier German universities offer extremely competitive Bachelor's, Master’s and Doctoral degree programmes, making them ideal choices for international students seeking a world-class education. Let’s look at some of the universities in Germany:

University QS World University Rankings Popular Courses Tuition Fee Range Per Year
Technical University of Munich (TUM) 49
  • 14,400
  • Bachelor in Management & Technology
  • Master in Consumer Science
Ludwig Maximilians University Munich 59
  • 20,000
  • Master in Quantitative Economics
  • MSc Data Science
Heidelberg University 65
  • 14,000
  • BA in Media and communication management
  • M.Eng. in Information Technologies
Free University of Berlin 118
  • 16,500
  • BSc in Biochemistry
  • MSc in Psychology
Humboldt University Berlin 131
  • 12,000
  • MSc in Biophysics
  • MA in Information Science
Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT) 141
  • 14,000
  • BSc in Bioengineering
  • BSc in Mechanical Engineering

Scholarships for International Students in Germany

There are some universities in Germany that may not require students to pay any tuition at all or may only require a very low amount of tuition or administrative fees. Nonetheless, it is possible to receive funding for your studies if you apply to a specific degree programme at a public institution and are accepted into that program or apply for financial aid. The following is a list of some of the prestigious German scholarships available to students:

  • DAAD Scholarship
  • Friedrich Ebert Stiftung Scholarships
  • Erasmus Joint Scholarships
  • Heinrich Boll Foundation Scholarships
  • Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung Scholarships

Visa Requirements for the German Student Visa:

If you've been accepted to a university in Germany, you'll need to apply for a German Type D student visa. The visa requirements are as follows:

  • Passport with 1 year validity
  • Most recent passport-sized photos
  • Letter of acceptance from a university
  • Proof of English Proficiency test scores (IELTS, TOEFL)
  • Proof of German Proficiency (Zertifikat B1)
  • $11084.69 in the blocked account in Germany
  • Letter of motivation
  • CV/Resume

Work Opportunities in Germany for International Students

Germany has Europe's largest economy and a thriving job market to match. In Germany, international students can work part-time in a wide range of industries. Jobs range from serving customers at a bar to filing paperwork in an office to assisting professors in a classroom setting. Students should look for a part-time job related to their field of study. Let’s look at some popular jobs for students:

  • Barita
  • Cashier
  • Tutor
  • Library Assistant
  • Babysitter
  • Research Assistant
  • Translator
  • Delivery Person

Concluding Thoughts

The quality of higher education in Germany lives up to its reputation as one of the greatest places to get an education at the lowest possible cost. Top-tier educational institutions, experienced lecturers, innovative tools for expanding one's horizons of understanding, stimulating classroom settings, and fantastic industry experience opportunities can provide you peace of mind as you embark on your academic journey. Studying in Germany is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity made better by the country's variety of welcoming towns and plentiful job opportunities. As a student in this country, you will be presented with several opportunities to grow and learn.

data.title: Why Students Choose Japan as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose Japan as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: Japan is now known as one of the top destinations for international students from other Asian nations. Japan offers the best of all worlds for those who want to study abroad but are not comfortable traveling too far. Compared to places like North America on the other side of the planet

faq.question: What is the minimum hourly wage in Japan?
faq.answer: You may earn about $27 per hour working part-time in Japan. The typical hourly wage is around $7.

faq.question: When studying in Japan, will it be possible to submit an application for a new scholarship or an extension of an existing one?
faq.answer: If you want to extend your scholarship while you are studying in Japan, get in touch with the institution that organized it or the institution. An additional scholarship application may be made. The deadline and terms for qualifying vary depending on the scholarship provider. Get more information by speaking with your institution.

data.description:
Study in the Japan

Why Students Consider Japan as a Study Abroad Destination?

  1. Japan is now known as one of the top destinations for international students from other Asian nations. Japan offers the best of all worlds for those who want to study abroad but are not comfortable traveling too far. Compared to places like North America on the other side of the planet, Bangladesh and India are only a few hours away from its great, world-class educational institutions. In addition to being close by, Japan offers a diverse culture, unique way of life, and a rich tradition.
  2. One of the best STEM education systems in the world is found in the high-tech nation of Japan. In Japan, there are many different programs and courses from which international students can choose. Every course is designed to provide students the best academic edge available in their area. Due to its well-regarded educational system and significant contributions to the academic community, Japan features a number of top-ranked universities.
  3. Japan's culture and way of life are unique. Simple ways of life, healthful practices, hospitality, and delectable Japanese cuisine are all fantastic things to take advantage of while you're here. Japanese pop culture appeals to young people all around the world. Reading Japanese comics introduced many students to the Hiragana alphabet, while watching anime introduced them to spoken Japanese. Japan has a strong influence on East Asian culture while also having a sizable impact on Western and American culture.

Top Universities & Courses in Japan

When deciding which intake to accept, it's important to weigh a number of aspects, such as program accessibility, academic accomplishment, admission test scores, acceptance rates, employment possibilities, and level of program etc. Japan's primary intakes are as follows:

  • Fall: April to July
  • Spring: October to November
  • Summer: February to April

Now that you know when to apply, let's have a look at some of Ireland's finest educational institutions and the programs they offer:

University QS World University Rankings Average Tuition Fee Per Year (USD) Popular Programs
The University of Tokyo 23 4,000 to 7,000
  • Master of International Technology Management
  • MSc in Chemistry and Biotechnology
Kyoto University 36 6,000
  • Integrated Engineering Course, Human Security Engineering
  • International Program in Intelligence Science and Technology
Tokyo Institute of Technology (Tokyo Tech) 55 4,500
  • BSc in Biomedical engineering
  • Msc in Systems and Control Engineering
Tohoku University 79 4,100 to 6,100
  • Bsc in International Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
  • Masters in International Environmental Leadership program
Nagoya University 112 4,000
  • BSc in Mechanical Engineering Economics
  • MSc in Biology
Kyushu University 135 5,700
  • LLB in Corporate and Business Law
  • BSc in Civil engineering

Scholarships for International Students in Japan

It might be costly for students from Bangladesh & India to study in Japan. Scholarships are a lifesaver in situations like this. Numerous annual scholarships are made available by Japanese universities and the Japanese government to international students. All students from all countries are welcome to apply for one of the many available scholarships. Here are a few of the best scholarships available in Japanese universities:

  • Scholarships by Mext
  • KUAS-E Scholarship
  • Tokyo Institute of Technology Scholarship
  • Jasso Scholarship
  • ADB Scholarship University of Tokyo
  • Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship
  • kGU Graduate School International Scholarships

Research grants that are given out based on merit and need may be interesting to you. When conducting research, be sure to look into the requirements so that you may submit applications for grants that have a higher chance of getting accepted.

Visa Requirements for Student Visa to Japan

When your acceptance to a Japanese university has been confirmed, you can begin the process of applying for a student visa. The following documents are required to get a student visa for Japan:

  • Valid passport
  • 2 passport sized colored photos
  • Student Visa Application Form signed by a consulate or the embassy
  • Certificate of Eligibility
  • Letter of acceptance from a Japanese university
  • Academic certificates & Transcripts
  • Motivation letter
  • Proof of finance

Before sending in your application for a student visa to Japan, make sure to review the checklist carefully. Your application may take longer to process if you haven't submitted all necessary information, if your documents need to be reviewed, or if your personal circumstances require additional time.

Work Opportunities in Japan for International Students

Students with valid work permits might find a variety of part-time job opportunities in Japan. A valid student visa is required in order to obtain the work permit sticker that must be affixed to your passport before you begin working. With a valid work visa, international students can put in 28 hours per week during the academic year and 40 hours per week during holidays. Some of the popular part-time jobs for students are as follows:

  • Packing
  • Bed Making & Hotel Cleaning
  • Sorting
  • Cafe/Restaurant Worker
  • Tutor
  • Receptionist
  • Convenience Store Staff
  • Babysitter
  • Delivery person

Concluding Thoughts

If you are a student from another country who is thinking about attending university in Japan, your best bet will be to enroll in a program that gives you the opportunity to continue making progress in your studies outside of the classroom. Anyone who chooses to study in a foreign country ought to make it a priority to incorporate having fun, getting to know intriguing locals, and developing lifelong friendships into their curriculum. We have high hopes that these guidelines to study in Japan for international students like yourself will be of tremendous assistance. Therefore, make sure to carefully consider your next step! Check to see whether your decision will end up being beneficial to you in the long run.

data.title: Why Students Choose Ireland as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaTitle: Why Students Choose Ireland as a Study Abroad Destination
data.metaDescription: The brilliance of Irish degrees is acknowledged globally. From language, humanities, and arts universities, highly regarded business schools, and centers of scientific and technological excellence, students can select from a wide selection of programmes to suit their needs.

faq.question: Can international students work in Ireland?
faq.answer: Graduates from non-EU countries who are legally living in Ireland are able to look for work or apply for a work visa via the Post-Study Pathways for International Students programme. A student may work full time, or up to 40 hours per week, during their allowed stay. And a student does not need to get a work visa while studying in Ireland for programmes that the Irish Department of Education and Skills recognises as lasting more than a year.

faq.question: Is Ireland a good choice for international students?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Ireland has eight QS World University Rankings 2023 universities. QS Top Universities’ Subject Rankings 2023 also highlight these universities! International graduates have several chances. Irish university degree programmes commonly incorporate job experiences. You can get amazing experiences traveling beside the excellent education.

data.description:
Study in the Ireland

Why Students Choose Ireland as a Study Abroad Destination

  1. The brilliance of Irish degrees is acknowledged globally. From language, humanities, and arts universities, highly regarded business schools, and centers of scientific and technological excellence, students can select from a wide selection of programmes to suit their needs. There are 3 Irish institutions in the top 300 of QS World University Rankings 2023 and several more universities and institutes of technology among the very best in Europe.
  2. Ireland is a country with a rich cultural past and a track record of global innovation. Ireland's distinctive innovative and creative culture is a crucial component of the Irish experience. Also, when compared to other student destinations like France, the UK, and other countries, the cost of living and tuition is significantly lower. Living in Ireland is a memorable experience thanks to the country's welcoming atmosphere and friendliness.
  3. Graduates from Ireland are leaders in their communities, pioneers in their fields, and global ambassadors for excellence. The key to success can be obtained in Ireland through education and connections. Businesses that need a highly talented, educated, and skilled workforce to propel their success prefer to locate in Ireland. Google, Facebook, Pfizer, Apple, and Intel, to mention a few, have all made Ireland their European headquarters.

Top Universities & Courses in Ireland

When making the best intake decision, consider factors including programme availability, academic performance, admission test results, acceptance rates, employment prospects, and degree of programme preparedness before making your choice. The following are the main intakes in Ireland:

  • Fall: September intake
  • Spring: January intake

Now that you know the intakes let’s look at some of the top universities in Ireland and their popular courses:

University QS World University Rankings Average Tuition Fee Per Year (EUR) Popular Programs
Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin 98 11,364
  • BSc in Molecular Medicine
  • MS in Data Science
University College Dublin 181 20,500
  • BSc in Architecture
  • ME Civil Engineering
University of Galway 270 32,000
  • Bachelor of Arts English
  • Bachelors in Business Information
University College Cork 303 30,000
  • BA in Business and Financial Economics
  • MSc in Nursing
Dublin City University 471 4,000
  • MSc in Strategic Learning & Development
  • MSc in Management

Scholarships for International Students in Ireland

Irish universities and colleges offer a variety of scholarships, which you can qualify and apply for if you plan ahead. Depending on the requirements, course, and institution, these can be partial or full scholarships. Some of the available scholarships in Ireland are as follows:

  • The Walsh Fellowship
  • University College Dublin International Scholarships
  • The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
  • University of Limerick Indian Student Scholarships
  • Government of Ireland Postgraduate Scholarship
  • Inlaks Shivdasani Scholarship

You can research both need-based awards and merit-based awards - be sure to look into the eligibility criteria so you apply for awards you have a greater chance of securing.

Visa Requirements for the Irish Student Visa

The majority of international students who wish to study in Ireland apply for a study visa this means that the course you might be applying for lasts longer than 3 months. Application fee for student visa to Ireland is EUR 60. The visa requirements are:

  • Valid passport
  • 2 passport sized colored photos
  • Letter of acceptance from an Irish institution
  • Proof of finances of 10,000 EUR
  • Health insurance details
  • English proficiency test scores- IELTS, TOEFL or other accepted tests
  • CV/Resume
  • Evidence of payment to the university

Review the Ireland student visa application checklist twice before submitting. If you haven't provided all required information, if your documentation has to be checked, or if your personal circumstances require additional time, your application may be processed more slowly.

Work Opportunities in Ireland for International Students

Ireland has traditionally been a preferred destination for students because of all the benefits it provides. In addition to having a top-notch educational system and a friendly atmosphere, the nation provides several options for students to pay for their higher education. Searching for part-time employment in Ireland is one such strategy. The top part-time positions in Ireland that are open to international students include:

  • Barista
  • Research assistant
  • Teaching assistant
  • Library assistant
  • Tutor
  • Receptionist
  • Administration officer
  • Tour Guide

Concluding Thoughts

Studying in Ireland is beneficial in more ways than one, despite the fact that the cost of living is slightly higher than in other countries where English is the primary language. It is an outstanding location for overseas students to further their education due to the abundance of high-quality employment possibilities and prestigious educational institutions. The growing number of employment prospects and the attraction of major industries towards the country work as the icing on the cake for Ireland, which is becoming an enormous source of curiosity for international students from India and other South Asian nations. Your time spent studying in Ireland, which is itself a stunningly beautiful country, is sure to be one of the highlights of your life.
